parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the oil hose can cause the engine to lose oil rapidly, leading to engine damage or failure, and potentially causing a loss of traction or control, especially if it occurs while driving at high speeds.
symptoms: Oil leakage
low oil warning light
difficulty steering
oil covering the right side of the car
engine damage or failure.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the radiator can cause hot coolant to splash onto the windshield, potentially causing a loss of visibility, and may also cause damage to the engine or other components.
symptoms: Radiator explosion
hot coolant splashing onto the windshield
brittle plastic edges on the radiator.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Engine failure can cause the vehicle to stall or lose power, potentially leading to a loss of control or accidents, especially if it occurs while driving at high speeds.
symptoms: Engine failure
engine replacement
no obvious warning signs leading to the event.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the oil line coupling can cause a sudden and significant loss of engine oil, leading to engine damage, smoke, and potentially a fire hazard. This can also cause a hazardous situation on the road, as oil spills onto the road surface and other vehicles.
symptoms: Sudden smell of burning oil
oil light on the dashboard
smoke pouring from the engine bay
oil puddles forming under the car
oil covering the rear of the car and wheels
oil dripping from the bottom of the car.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the shifter can cause the vehicle to become stuck in gear, leading to a loss of control and increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: The shifter becomes loose and broken
the vehicle becomes stuck in gear (typically 3rd gear)
the driver is unable to shift gears
the shifter feels unstable or wobbly.
